page.title: 07FARMING - 1.
page.content: Agriculture in this area is mixed. Much of the land is wet and on the springline. Many small grass paddocks particularly in Oddington and Maugesbury are used by people who have horses for hunting with the Heythrop Hunt. Sycamore Farm, Maugesbury, is an owner farmed 124 hectares. 20 of these are on Stow Hill where there used to be tanks for Maugesbury's water supply. Water from the springline in the fields was pumped to these tanks. Sheep are farmed here and there are 80 hectares of corn. Mount Pleasant Farm, Oddington, was run until 1985 as a stock farm for game birds such as pheasants. It is now a corn farm.
